channel.title: PodX Test Feed
channel.description: This is a test feed using audio where Katharine Murphy and Guardian Australia's political team examine what’s happening in Australian politics and why it matters to you. There is additional data to show information about Mark Zuckerburg's dog while the episode plays back.
channel.itunes:author: The Guardian
channel.itunes:summary: This is a test feed using audio where Katharine Murphy and Guardian Australia's political team examine what’s happening in Australian politics and why it matters to you. There is additional data to show information about Mark Zuckerburg's dog while the episode plays back.

item.title: A whole lot of images
item.description: The official campaign post-mortem has been completed by Jay Weatherill and Craig Emerson, but with a whole lot of pictures of a dog? Katharine Murphy sits down with Weatherill to discuss the findings of the ‘warts-and-all’ review. Was Bill Shorten found untrustworthy by voters? Will the party continue to be overshadowed by the Rudd-Gillard-Rudd years? How will they combat disinformation in the future?
item.itunes:author: The Guardian
item.itunes:keywords: Jay Weatherill, Australian politics, Australia news, Bill Shorten, Scott Morrison, Malcolm Turnbull, Labor party, Liberal party
item.itunes:subtitle: The official campaign post-mortem has been completed by Jay Weatherill and Craig Emerson, but with a whole lot of pictures of a dog? item.title: Some text
item.description: As Arthur Sinodinos takes over from Joe Hockey as ambassador to the US, Katharine Murphy talks through his 20-year career. From Scott Morrison’s work ethic and views on climate change to the future of working with Donald Trump, Sinodinos discusses the Coalition’s approach to the next term. Some text about dogs shows
item.itunes:author: The Guardian
item.itunes:keywords: Arthur Sinodinos, Joe Hockey, Australia news, Australian politics, Scott Morrison, Bill Shorten, Donald Trump, US politics

From Scott Morrison’s work ethic and views on climate change to the future of working with Donald Trump, Sinodinos discusses the Coalition’s approach to the next term. Some text about dogs shows

podx:text.podx:caption: About the Puli: First, there are those dreadlocks, the instantly recognizable feature of the Puli (pronounced “Poo-lee”—”Pulik” is the plural). The coat’s naturally occurring cords are wooly, dense, and weatherproof. Either corded or brushed out, Puli coats require lots of attention. Under the dreads there’s a compact but powerful dog, standing 16 to 17 inches at the shoulder. Pulik are remarkably agile and light on their feet, earning a reputation as the “acrobat of the dog world.”

item.title: Support event
item.description: Katharine Murphy sits down with the president of the National Farmers’ Federation, Fiona Simson, to talk about their new drought policy. It looks at long-term objectives it thinks the Coalition should be considering to enhance resilience for farmers. But is the government likely to listen? What did Barnaby Joyce achieve as drought envoy? I ask for some money as this is discussed – Full Story podcast
item.itunes:author: The Guardian
item.itunes:keywords: Drought, Australia news, Liberal party, Coalition, Australian politics, Farming, Environment

item.title: Web link and an image
item.description: The shadow climate minister, Mark Butler, sits down with Katharine Murphy to discuss Labor’s ambitious climate policies. Did they lead to Labor’s election loss? And will Labor’s stance on climate change remain ‘unshakeable’?• Labor’s climate policies are ‘unshakeable’ despite election loss, Mark Butler says. There is a picture of a Pulli dog, and a link to an article about a famous owner.
item.itunes:author: The Guardian
item.itunes:keywords: Australia news, Australian politics, Climate change, Environment, Labor party, Liberal party, Greta Thunberg
